single_stimulus.title: Single Stimulus
single_stimulus.desc: Simulates the response of a cardiac cell to a single electrical stimulus.

multiple_stimuli.title: 8 Stimuli
multiple_stimuli.desc: Observes the cellular response to a series of stimuli with a fixed interval.

s1s2.title: S1-S2 Protocol
s1s2.desc: Standard protocol to investigate cardiac tissue refractoriness and vulnerability.

s1_s2.title: S1-S2 Protocol
s1_s2.desc: Standard protocol to investigate cardiac tissue refractoriness and vulnerability.

restitution_curve.title: Restitution Curve
restitution_curve.desc: Analyzes the relationship between the diastolic interval (DI) and the action potential duration (APD).

fhn.title: FitzHugh-Nagumo
fhn.desc: Simplified model of cardiac excitability in one dimension.

ms_1d.title: Mitchell-Schaeffer 1D
ms_1d.desc: Mitchell-Schaeffer model extended to one spatial dimension.

model_2d.title: 2D Tissue Model
model_2d.desc: Simulates 2D wave propagation using Mitchell-Schaeffer or Minimal Model.

source_sink.title: Source-Sink Mismatch
source_sink.desc: Simulates propagation through a variable gap in an obstacle.

modals.ms_desc_base: The Mitchell-Schaeffer model describes action potential propagation using a voltage variable (v) and a gate variable (h), simplifying ionic currents.
modals.minimal_desc_base: The Minimal Model is a 4-variable model that accurately reproduces restitution characteristics and spiral wave dynamics of human cardiac tissue.

model_2d.desc: This tool simulates electrical propagation in 2D cardiac tissue using reaction-diffusion mathematical models. It allows investigating phenomena such as spiral wave formation, reentry, and conduction blocks caused by heterogeneities.

steps.1: Configure geometry and tissue properties in the sidebar.
steps.5: Use the player to view the result.
steps.6: Click on the chart to see the action potential at that point.

model_2d.math_intro: The simulation solves the monodomain reaction-diffusion equation, which describes how transmembrane potential propagates through the tissue.
model_2d.eq_diffusion_desc: Where V is voltage, D is the conductivity tensor (diffusion), and I_ion represents the ionic currents of the chosen cell model.

minimal.title: Minimal Model
minimal.vars: 4 state variables: u (voltage), v, w, s (gates)
minimal.currents: 3 phenomenological currents: J_fi (fast inward), J_so (slow outward), J_si (slow inward)

numerical_details: Rush-Larsen: Used for integration of gate variables (h, v, w, s).

features.fibrosis_desc: Allows defining tissue regions with zero or reduced conductivity, simulating scars or diffuse fibrosis.
features.transmurality_desc: Simulates electrophysiological differences between heart layers (Endocardium, Mid-Myocardium, and Epicardium) by altering local cell parameters.

glossary.L_N: L: Tissue size | N: Mesh resolution (points)
glossary.sigma: σ_l / σ_t: Longitudinal and Transverse Conductivity (diffusion)
glossary.tau_in_out: τ_in: Depolarization time | τ_out: Repolarization time
glossary.u_levels: u_o / u_u: Resting potential and threshold levels
glossary.tau_constants: τ_v, τ_w, τ_s: Gate time constants

ms.title: Mitchell-Schaeffer
ms.desc: Single stimulus simulation on a single MS cell.

minimal.title: Minimal Model
minimal.desc: Single stimulus simulation on a single Minimal cell.
S1-S2 on Minimal Model to study refractoriness.

minimal.title: Minimal Model
minimal.desc: Generates restitution curve using Minimal Model.
